dct_description_sm: [1709], with attribution: P.I. Peeters. Issued in El atlas abreviado ... 3. ed. / F. de Afferden. -- Amberes [Antwerp] : H. & C. Verdussen, 1709. Reissued by the widow of H. Verdussen in 1725.
[1739], lacking attribution or title. Issued in El atlas abreviado ... , 1739.

Untitled double hemisphere map of the world. California labeled as such, and shown as an island with two northern bays. Directly to the north is Mare Rubrum. Map surrounded by mythological figures in the corners and the cusps between the hemispheres. Based on the earlier Peeters map of 1692.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
